publishEvent(bytes,bytes32[],bytes32,byt.details: This function should be called for every subscriber that is subscribed to the event.

params.logIndex: The index of the event in our transaction.
params.receiptsRoot: The receipts root which contains the event.
params.receiptsRootProof: A merkle proof proving the receiptsRoot in the block header.
params.srcSlotTxSlotPack: The slot where we want to read the header from and the slot where                          the tx executed, packed as two uint64s.
params.subscription: The subscription data (sourceChainId, sourceAddress, callbackAddress, eventSig).
params.txIndexRLPEncoded: The index of our transaction inside the block RLP encoded.

publishEvent(bytes,bytes32[],bytes32,byt.notice: Publishes an event emit to a callback Subscriber, given an event proof.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory[] memory,bytes32,bytes memory,uint256,address,bytes32) pure returns (bytes32[] memory,bytes memory)

documentation.text: @notice Checks that the light client for a given chainId is consistent.
@notice Checks that the chainId is not frozen.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Timestamp is not set for slot."

arguments.value: Timestamp is not set for slot.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Timestamp is not set for slot."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Must wait longer to use this slot."

arguments.value: Must wait longer to use this slot.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Must wait longer to use this slot."

documentation.text: @notice Checks that the light client delay is adequate.
@notice Executes the callback function on the subscriber, and marks the event publish as successful or failed.
